meanings.sent1: Nancy is a name that some boys have.
meanings.sent2: My friend's brother is named Nancy.
meanings.sent3: When Nancy and his friends play, they always have fun.
meanings.sent4: The name Nancy shines brightly among the other names.
meanings.sent5: Nancy, the name, sounds cheerful and friendly.

meanings.definition: A pejorative term for a homosexual man.
meanings.sent1: Some people use Nancy as a mean word for a man who likes other men.
meanings.sent2: He was hurt when someone called him Nancy at school.
meanings.sent3: The boys teased him, calling him Nancy, but he just laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: Being called Nancy felt like a sharp sting to his pride.
meanings.sent5: The word Nancy can be used to hurt, but it shouldn't be.

meanings.definition: A pejorative term for an effeminate man.
meanings.sent1: They used Nancy to describe him because he was different from the other boys.
meanings.sent2: He didn't like it when people called him Nancy just because he was gentle.
meanings.sent3: Despite the teasing, he embraced his Nancy side with grace.
meanings.sent4: The word Nancy felt like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: His Nancy traits made him unique and special in his own way.
